Articles.Content:
I just thought i would share the holiday cheer and spread the joy, also, im actually getting somewhere in career now after the initial grind, upgrading all my buildings to the next tier, except the r&d labs, that's damned expensive!!!

now if i could only figure out how to fly a feckin vtol properly, i just end up using parachutes.

That's great! I'm playing Career as well, didn't get anywhere else than Kerbin and Mun yet, but I have everything researched from the 2nd tier R&D (nuclear engines and all those).

The strange thing: I've had a mission end just a few minutes ago, it was a mission to Mun and back, got back with loads of Science, got like 2500 Science from ONE place on the Mun! (playing with DMagic Orbital Science mod, lots of new scientific objects to use)

Research happened, now going to sleep. Tomorrow's mission - to harvest Science from Minmus, to build a Kerbin Orbital Science Station (KOSS) and get ready for Duna.

Edited December 21, 2014 by Spaps

I'm actually quite surprised at the level of difficulty for KSP career mode, even on the default mode I'm playing at. I've been playing career since 0.22, and aside from the big break form KSP I took for a month or so I've been making steady headway. Even with a little over 2.1 million funds right now, its a struggle to make cost-effective spacecraft and can get into orbit, transfer to a moon, land, get back into orbit,m then come back in one piece. I applaud Squad; this update has made career awesome!

I have to agree with Thomas988, in prior updates I wouldn't even touch Career mode, but THIS update brought a fresh feel to this game. you can actually feel like a Space Agency manager, pilot and space pioneer. It's like a brand new game!

I agree as well. Planes finally have a use for survey missions. It would be great for the surveys to also take us to various points of interest and Easter eggs as well. I have sent my first probe to the mun, rescued a kerbal from orbit, done a tonne of surveys on kerbin, now I'm off to deploy satellites and start sending manned missions to the mun and minmus. Remote tech should really be integrated now, with these new satellite contracts it makes a lot of sense.

Whilst your at it squad, fancy integrating infernal robotics and kerbal alarms & engineer as well? Great update.
